intro: Dodecatheon cusickii, commonly known as the Cusick's glory-of-the-snow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and hairy, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Dodecatheon cusickii is a short-lived perennial that plays an important role in supporting pollinators during the early growing season.
